meanings.definition: A soft, absorbent paper used for cleaning or wiping.
meanings.sent1: I ran out of bumwad while cleaning up the spill.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps a roll of bumwad in the kitchen for quick cleanups.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the bumwad was a fun toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her tears soaked through the bumwad as she wiped her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The bumwad felt gentle against his skin as he dabbed the cut.

meanings.sent1: The costume was made of cheap bumwad that tore easily.
meanings.sent2: He regretted buying the bumwad shoes that fell apart after a week.
meanings.sent3: The bumwad umbrella turned inside out in the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The bumwad fabric faded quickly after just a few washes.
meanings.sent5: The bumwad blanket was scratchy and uncomfortable to sleep under.

meanings.definition: To line or cover with bumwad.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bumwad the shelves to protect them from scratches.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully bumwad the delicate glassware before packing.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to bumwad the entire room with toilet paper.
meanings.sent4: The artist bumwad the canvas before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic bumwad the tools to keep them organized in the toolbox.
